class.name: NanoSender
class.description: This class encapsulates the RPC calls account_info, block_create, work_generate, and process into one method and signal. [method set_connection_parameters] must be used to initialize the sender.

method.name: send
method.description: Send an amount. Destination account should be created from a public address using [method NanoAccount.set_address], which will automatically set the public key needed for this call. The url parameter is optional, and can be used to override the node_url and work_url set in [method set_connection_parameters].

method.name: set_connection_parameters
method.description: This must be called before attempting to do any sending. default_representative is used for newly created accounts. auth_header can be generated with [method NanoRequest.basic_auth_header] for Basic Authentication (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication), or any other token depending on the requirements of the node proxy. Work URL is required if work must be generated at a different destination than the RPC Node. If the same destination is used for both, use_peers will likely need to be true. For more information on Work Generation, see https://docs.nano.org/integration-guides/work-generation/.

signal.name: nano_send_completed
signal.description: This signal is sent whenever the send has finished, regardless of success or failure. On a success, the message field will be the block hash of the received block (necessary for tracking confirmation), and the response code will be 0. On a failure, the message will be an error message, and the response code will be a positive integer.
